metadata.scenario: Customer support interaction about a billing issue

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a charge on my latest bill. I was charged $75, but my plan is supposed to be $50. I'm pretty sure something's wrong.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly look into that for you. Could you please provide me with your account number or the phone number associated with the account?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's 555-123-4567. And honestly, this isn't the first time I've had a billing issue. It's getting a little frustrating.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. One moment while I access your account... Okay, I see the charge. It appears there was an overage for data usage last month. You exceeded your data limit by 2GB.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Overage? That's ridiculous! I'm always on Wi-Fi. Is there any way to get that charge waived? Also, why didn't I get a notification that I was close to my limit? Shouldn't that happen automatically?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me check what I can do regarding the overage charge. As for the notification, I see here that notifications were disabled on the account. I am unsure how this happened, but I can enable them for you now. I've applied a one-time credit to your account for $25 as a courtesy. Your new balance is $50. Would you like me to enable data usage notifications?
